function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Increased time spent in the bedroom not sleeping, but engaging in activities like watching movies or using social media, which can be problematic for resident well-being.","Impact":"Disruption of sleep, increased nighttime alertness, reduced melatonin, and shifted circadian rhythms, leading to decreased well-being.","Mitigation":"Encourage spatial variety in small apartment units to support different activities, limit or eliminate pre-bedtime fluorescent light exposure, and create shared spaces for entertainment and socializing.","Technologies":"Use of adjustable lighting, smart curtains, and soundproofing materials.","People":"Residents in small apartment units, especially in shared living arrangements.","Owner":"Architects, interior designers, and building management."},{"Description":"Exterior city noise pollution in apartment housing as a source of annoyance that prevents restful sleep.","Impact":"Disrupted sleep patterns and decreased well-being due to excessive noise pollution.","Mitigation":"Implementing redundant air-sealed triple glazed windows in apartment housing to mitigate noise pollution, improve thermal comfort, and increase security.","Technologies":"Triple glazed windows, soundproofing materials, and smart ventilation systems.","People":"Residents in apartment housing affected by city noise pollution.","Owner":"Architects, building developers, and building management."},{"Description":"Inadequate daylighting and lack of regulation of human circadian clock due to poor environmental design in residential spaces.","Impact":"Disrupted circadian clock regulation and reduced well-being due to inadequate natural light exposure.","Mitigation":"Implement small adaptations such as painting walls white, reorganizing occupant activities closer to windows, and discouraging the use of windowless spaces as dwellings.","Technologies":"Smart lighting systems, daylighting sensors, and architectural design that maximizes natural light exposure.","People":"Residents in poorly lit residential spaces.","Owner":"Architects, interior designers, and building management."}]}
